data.title: WGGS TV set to celebrate quarter-century on the air
data.meta_description: WGGS TV 16 in Greenville is celebrating its 25th anniversary this month. \n A series of classic \
data.text:
WGGS TV 16 in Greenville is celebrating its 25th anniversary this month.

A series of classic "Nite Line" variety shows as well as new live shows will mark the "25 Days of Celebration" programming by the Christian television station.

Other popular shows, such as "Down Home Gospel" and "The Peggy Denny Show," will air specials to commemorate the anniversary, according to Greg West of Creative Services with the station. The celebration will conclude with the "TV 16 Silver Jubilee," a 25-hour live broadcast beginning at 8 p.m. Oct. 24. Station founders Jimmy and Joanne Thompson will host the finale beginning at 6 p.m. Oct. 25. The celebration will feature musical guests, vintage video clips, bloopers and never-before-seen interviews. The first segment of the 25-hour telecast also will be hosted by the Thompsons with gospel recording artist Jerry Goff. Ventriloquist Beverly Smith and Alfred of Enoree will appear. Gwen Hall will take over as host at 11 p.m. Dorothy and Russell Spaulding of Augusta, Ga., will begin a stint as hosts at 2 a.m. Oct. 25 and will welcome the Praise Team from Praise Cathedral in Greer and contemporary recording artist Dana Russell as guests. Hosting duties will go to the Revs. Bob and Clara Hicks of Anderson at 6 a.m. Oct. 25, and the Rev. Ron Carpenter of Redemption Outreach Center will take over at 8 a.m. Greta Campbell and Pat Welch, who have been with the station since its first broadcast in 1972, will host the show beginning at 9 a.m. Oct. 25. Damascus Road of Spartanburg will perform. Vickie Strickland of Spartanburg and the cast of the children's show "Behind the Waterfall" also will appear during that segment. Dr. Gerald Hopkins of New Life Christian Fellowship of Greenville and his father, Dr. Paul Hopkins of Athens, Ga., will host a segment beginning at noon. Ken Turner, formerly of The Blackwood Brothers, will host the 2 p.m. portion, of the show and Darrell and Sandy McClaren of Asheville will take over at 4 p.m. The Thompsons will return as hosts for the finale beginning at 6 p.m. Oct. 25, which will feature musical guests, vintage video clips, bloopers and never-before-seen interviews. The public is welcome to be in the studio audience for any part of the 25-hour broadcast. The studio is at 3409 Rutherford Road Extension, Taylors. For more information, call (864) 244-1616. -- DEBRA LESTER
